metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for comment lists with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens with Page Size section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully showing Miscellaneous Community Settings with Page Size dropdowns

steps.action: Click on Comments Page Size dropdown to expand it
steps.expected: Dropdown expands showing all available options: 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items (selected), 50 items, 100 items

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set comments page size to 5 items

steps.action: Select '5 items' from Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: Dropdown value changed to '5 items' successfully

steps.expected: Settings saved successfully with confirmation message
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, 'Item successfully saved.' notification appeared

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save comments page size and verify persistence

steps.expected: Comments Page Size should still show '5 items'
steps.actual: Comments Page Size shows '5 items' - value persisted correctly after navigation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set comments page size to 100 items

steps.action: Select '100 items' from Comments Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: Dropdown value changed to '100 items' successfully

steps.expected: Settings saved successfully with confirmation message
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, 'Item successfully saved.' notification appeared

observations: Current default value on this installation is 25 items (not 5 items as mentioned in requirements for new installations - this may be a previously configured value)
The dropdown provides 6 distinct page size options: 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, and 100 items
Save operation provides immediate visual feedback via 'Item successfully saved.' notification
Settings persist correctly across navigation within the admin interface
